description.info: Earned a Master's of Science degree in the field of Computer Engineering.

Transferred federal service jobs from the Air Force to the Army. I am now working as a Computer Engineer working on Modeling & Simulation software for Network & Communications analysis at Aberdeen Proving Grounds, MD.
The journal article entitled, 'Adaptive Opportunistic Airborne Sensor Sharing', built on a previously published IEEE research paper on the same subject
The research paper entitled, 'Adaptive Task Reallocation for Airborne Sensor Sharing', stemmed from the research I was conducting at the Air Force Research Lab
Started taking courses at Syracuse University to achieve a Master's degree in Computer Engineering.
Proven to have core knowledge of cybersecurity-related best practices and vulnerabilities.

Directly out of college, I started as an Associate Computer Scientist with AFRL's Information Directorate in Rome, NY. I mostly worked on researching, integrating, and prototyping information management services.
Earned a Bachelor's of Science with Honors degree in the field of Computer Science with a Global Enterprise Technologies minor.

My very first internship as a Web Applications Developer for this large tech company was a very rewarding experience and allowed me to learn a large breadth of web technologies, such as HTML5, CSS3, C#, ASP.NET, Apache Server, Microsoft IIS, and more!

description.emphasis: GET program at University of Delaware
description.info: The Global Enterprise Technologies program at UD allowed me to take on an internship at a technology company in the area, while still earning credits towards my undergraduated degree!
My first tech-related job was working the support desk of a small internet service provider in Wilmington, DE serving small-to-medium-sized businesses in Delaware and Philadelphia.
Fresh from high school, I knew my passion was coding and computer architectures, so I decided to pursue a Bachelor's in Computer Science degree at UD.
